episodeTitle: Trap in a Desperate Situation! Breaking Into Rain Dinners
episodeTitleJapanese: 絶体絶命の罠！レインディナーズ突入
episodeTitleRomanized: Zettai Zetsumei no Wana! Rein Dināzu Totsunyū
description: The Straw Hat Pirates infiltrate Crocodile's casino, Rain Dinners, but fall into an elaborate trap and are imprisoned in a Seastone cage. Princess Vivi is rescued by Pell but captured by Miss All Sunday. Crocodile reveals his invincible Suna Suna no Mi Devil Fruit powers and announces Operation Utopia, his plan to destroy the Alabasta Kingdom.

events.title: Straw Hats and Smoker Trapped in Seastone Cage
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates (Luffy, Zoro, Nami, Usopp) and Marine Captain Smoker fall into Crocodile's elaborate trap at Rain Dinners casino and are imprisoned in a cage made of Seastone, which weakens Devil Fruit users.
events.significance: Represents one of the most dire situations the Straw Hats have faced, being captured by a Warlord of the Sea with seemingly no means of escape. Creates an uneasy alliance between pirates and Marines against a common enemy.

quotes.text: Welcome to Rain Dinners. I've been expecting you.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile greets the trapped Straw Hats

events.title: Seastone Jitte Revealed
events.description: Smoker reveals that his jitte weapon is tipped with Seastone (sea prism stone), a rare mineral that affects Devil Fruit users the same way as the ocean, completely nullifying their powers on contact.
events.significance: First detailed explanation of Seastone's properties in the anime, introducing a critical weakness that can be exploited against Devil Fruit users. This establishes an important world-building element that will recur throughout the series.

quotes.text: The tip of my weapon is made of sea prism stone, a rare mineral that affects Devil Fruit users the same way as if they have fallen into the ocean.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker explains Seastone to the imprisoned Straw Hats

events.title: Luffy Weakened by Seastone Contact
events.description: When Smoker's Seastone jitte makes contact with Luffy, he becomes severely weakened and unable to use his Devil Fruit powers, demonstrating the debilitating effect of Seastone on Devil Fruit users.
events.significance: Provides a visceral demonstration of Seastone's effectiveness, showing how vulnerable even powerful Devil Fruit users become when exposed to it.

quotes.text: Why do I feel so weak all of a sudden?
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy reacts to contact with Seastone for the first time

events.title: Pell Rescues Vivi
events.description: Pell the Falcon, one of Alabasta's royal guardians, makes his debut by swooping down from the sky to rescue Princess Vivi from Baroque Works Billions who were attacking her.
events.significance: Introduces Pell as one of Alabasta's strongest defenders and establishes his role as Vivi's protector. Also debuts the Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Falcon, one of only five known flying Devil Fruit abilities.

quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi recognizes her guardian as he rescues her

events.title: Pell's Tobizume Technique
events.description: Pell uses his aerial combat technique, Tobizume (Flying Claws), to eliminate the Baroque Works Billions threatening Vivi, showcasing his combat abilities in falcon form.
events.significance: Demonstrates Pell's fighting prowess and establishes him as a formidable aerial combatant capable of protecting the royal family.

events.title: Miss All Sunday Defeats Pell and Captures Vivi
events.description: Miss All Sunday (Nico Robin) appears and uses her Hana Hana no Mi powers to simultaneously overpower both Vivi and Pell, despite Pell being one of Alabasta's strongest guardians. She then captures Vivi and takes her to Rain Dinners.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's overwhelming combat effectiveness and her importance to Baroque Works as Crocodile's right hand. Shows that even Alabasta's strongest defenders are no match for the organization's leadership.

quotes.text: You've been 'invited' to a gathering, Princess.
quotes.speaker: Miss All Sunday

events.title: Crocodile's Suna Suna no Mi Fully Revealed
events.description: When Vivi attacks Crocodile in desperation, her attack passes harmlessly through his body as he transforms into sand. Crocodile then explains that he has eaten the Suna Suna no Mi Devil Fruit, which allows him to become a Sand Human and transform his body into sand at will, making him immune to conventional physical attacks.
events.significance: First full demonstration and explanation of Crocodile's Logia-type Devil Fruit abilities, establishing him as a nearly invincible opponent. This reveals why Crocodile has been so confident and why defeating him will require unconventional means.

quotes.text: I've eaten the Suna Suna no Mi fruit which turns me into a Sand Human.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his Devil Fruit power to Vivi

events.title: Operation Utopia Announced
events.description: Crocodile reveals Operation Utopia, his master plan to overthrow and destroy the Kingdom of Alabasta. Miss All Sunday announces that it is noon and time for Operation Utopia to commence, signaling the beginning of the final stage of Baroque Works' conspiracy.
events.significance: Unveils the true scope of Crocodile's conspiracy and the imminent threat to Alabasta. This announcement marks the climax of the arc's tension and sets the stage for the final confrontation. The operation's goal is later revealed to include obtaining the ancient weapon Pluton.

quotes.text: Operation Utopia means the demise of the Kingdom of Alabasta.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile explains his plan to the captured heroes

quotes.text: It is already noon. It is time for Operation Utopia.
quotes.speaker: Miss All Sunday

quotes.text: Welcome to Rain Dinners. I've been expecting you.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile greets the trapped Straw Hats

quotes.text: The tip of my weapon is made of sea prism stone, a rare mineral that affects Devil Fruit users the same way as if they have fallen into the ocean.
quotes.speaker: Smoker

quotes.text: Why do I feel so weak all of a sudden?
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy experiences Seastone's effects for the first time

quotes.text: You've been 'invited' to a gathering, Princess.
quotes.speaker: Miss All Sunday

quotes.text: I've eaten the Suna Suna no Mi fruit which turns me into a Sand Human.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his Devil Fruit power

quotes.text: Operation Utopia means the demise of the Kingdom of Alabasta.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the seemingly hopeless situation the heroes find themselves in, trapped by a nearly invincible enemy with no apparent means of escape.
themes.symbolism: The Seastone cage represents the complete powerlessness of the Devil Fruit users, while Crocodile's sand transformation symbolizes the untouchable nature of those in absolute power.

themes.description: Marines and pirates are forced into an uneasy coexistence, both trapped by a Warlord who operates within legal boundaries while committing heinous acts.
themes.symbolism: The shared cage represents how the rigid structures of justice can fail to protect the innocent from those who manipulate the system.

themes.description: Pell's dedication to protecting Vivi demonstrates the unwavering loyalty of Alabasta's guardians, even when faced with overwhelming odds.
themes.symbolism: Pell's falcon form represents the guardian spirits of Alabasta, connecting to ancient Egyptian mythology where falcons symbolized divine protection.
culturalReferences: Egyptian mythology: Horus, the falcon-headed god of the sky and kingship, parallels Pell's role as guardian of Alabasta's royalty

themes.description: The episode explores how different forms of power have different limitations - Devil Fruits are nullified by Seastone, while even the strongest guardians can be overpowered.
themes.symbolism: Seastone represents the concept that all power has a weakness, no matter how formidable it may seem.

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile is at the height of his power and confidence in this episode, revealing his Devil Fruit abilities and master plan while the heroes are completely at his mercy.
keyActions: Successfully traps the Straw Hats and Smoker
Reveals Suna Suna no Mi powers to Vivi
quotes: I've eaten the Suna Suna no Mi fruit which turns me into a Sand Human.
Operation Utopia means the demise of the Kingdom of Alabasta.

characterSpotlights.development: Pell makes his debut as one of Alabasta's strongest warriors and Vivi's dedicated protector, though he is quickly overwhelmed by Baroque Works' leadership.
keyActions: Rescues Vivi from Baroque Works agents
Is defeated by Miss All Sunday

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her combat effectiveness and loyalty to Crocodile, effortlessly capturing Vivi and defeating Pell while executing Operation Utopia.
keyActions: Defeats both Vivi and Pell simultaneously
Captures Vivi and brings her to Rain Dinners
Announces the commencement of Operation Utopia
quotes: You've been 'invited' to a gathering, Princess.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi faces her worst fears as she witnesses the full extent of Crocodile's power and sees her kingdom's destruction become imminent.
keyActions: Is captured by Miss All Sunday
Attempts to attack Crocodile but fails

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded some of the action sequences, particularly Pell's rescue of Vivi and the fight against the Baroque Works Billions.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Fish' as the ending theme. The next episode (107) begins using 'Before Dawn' as the ending.
Pandaman (Oda's recurring Easter egg character) makes a cameo appearance on one of the slot machines in Rain Dinners around the 1:30 mark.
This episode had a TV rating of 14.2% and ranked 6th in viewership when it aired in Japan.
This episode corresponds to manga chapters 169 and 170, showing the pacing of approximately 2 chapters per episode typical of the Alabasta arc.
The Suna Suna no Mi is the first Logia-type Devil Fruit to have its powers fully explained and named in the anime since Smoker's Moku Moku no Mi.
Pell's Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Falcon is stated to be one of only five flying Devil Fruit abilities in existence, making it extremely rare.
